posts.cooked: Can anyone explain how to wire the brainbox SW-005?   Does it get wired directly to the VRM?  We are using a  power over ethernet cable.  Thank you for your help.

link_counts.title: Why you probably shouldn't use the second port on your OpenMesh OM5P Radio and embrace using an Ethernet Switch instead

posts.name: Christopher Ely
posts.cooked:
The SW-005 switch does not use power over Ethernet. In order to power the switch, you need to run 12V power from the PDP/PDH to the terminal block. Positive goes to V+, negative to V-. The ground terminal can be left empty. Since the switch has it’s own power regulation, it does not need to get power from the VRM. image 908×919 45.5 KB

image 908×919 45.5 KB

image 908×919 45.5 KB
Thank you for your help.  What size breaker do we use in the power distribution hub?

posts.name: Christopher Ely
posts.cooked: You can use a 10A or smaller breaker. Be sure to use the appropriate wire gage for the breaker size.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
The circled green terminal block pulls out from the box if that’s easier for OP to wire while on the robot. A dot of hot glue might be useful to prevent it from pulling out when you didn’t mean for it to.

Don’t run the powered end of any POE cables into the Brainbox - that could fry it.

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked:
FYI for anyone using brainboxes switches- the wire terminal is the same as the RSL terminal. There is also a lever lock version of this connector which we’ve switched to (for our RSL and switch) in an effort to eliminate screw terminals from our robot entirely- it’s much more resistant to vibration than the screw terminals and doesn’t require tools to use:

https://www.mouser.com/ProductDetail/Phoenix-Contact/1110582?qs=e8oIoAS2J1TEcPJGpQE8rg%3D%3D

EDIT: It was brought to my attention that using this terminal block for the RSL may not be a legal modification to the RSL. I’ve asked a Q&A question to clarify this:

Official FIRST Robotics Competition Question and Answer System

EDIT 2: it appears that using this terminal for the RSL is not legal- my apologies.

posts.name: Domtech
posts.cooked:
Wow what a bad q&a answer!

What if the lever style is used as a “repair” for a missing terminal connector? Why is the connector even considered part of the device?

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
Ryan_Blue:

EDIT 2: it appears that using this terminal for the RSL is not legal- my apologies.

Looks like Team Update 15 makes it legal.

posts.name: Chris LaSalle
posts.cooked: I have hooked in power to the box and wired according to the diagram for the Rev PDH and the RPM, I get power to the radio, but nothing is coming out of the box to the Limelight  no power or signal. There is no flashing of Tr Rx lights from the Brainbox or the Limelight. Anyone have a solution?  It would be appreciated.

posts.name: neev dadhania
posts.cooked: is the limelight powered? the SW-005 is not a PoE switch/injector.

posts.name: Jack
posts.cooked: Do you mean that I need to power limelight from PDH?

posts.name: neev dadhania
posts.cooked: yes, or with a PoE injector between the ethernet run from the switch and the limelight

posts.name: Jack
posts.cooked: Just for double checking. SW-005 only switch the Ethernet, I still need to provide the power from PDH?

posts.name: neev dadhania
posts.cooked:
yeah.

refer to this page from the ll docs for more info on wiring options:

Limelight takes a 12V input, but is built to function down to 4.5V. Its LEDs have a constant brightness down to 7V.

posts.name: Chris LaSalle
posts.cooked: Thanks for the info its all working now.
